@metadata.goal: The student can partition shapes into equal parts

steps.dialogue: Here's a bar. We're going to split it into two equal parts.
Click once in the middle to divide the bar into 2 equal parts.

prompt.text: Click in the center to divide

step.dialogue: Check your spacing. We need two equal parts.

events.name: pulse_center
events.description: Center point of bar pulses to indicate target location

step.dialogue: [event:pulse_center]You're working on it. Try clicking right in the middle so both parts are the same size.

events.name: show_midpoint_cut
events.description: Animated demonstration showing cut line appearing at exact center, then bar dividing into two equal sections

events.name: measure_sections_equal
events.description: Measurement lines appear showing both sections are equal width

step.dialogue: [event:show_midpoint_cut][event:measure_sections_equal]This is tricky, so let's do it together. Watch where I click—right in the middle. See how both parts are exactly the same size now? That's what equal parts means. There we go.

on_correct.dialogue: Perfect! You found the exact midpoint.
